rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: static pattern element that can not be instanciated. it will remain the same in the generated query (if none of its containing subpatterns is omited)

removed equivalent class: NecessarySubpatternCollection and (isPatternMadeUpOf some PatternConstituent) and (patternHasAuthor some Person) and (targetsOntology some Thing) and (makesUpPattern some Self ) and (hasCardinalityMax value 1) and (hasCardinalityMin value 1)
removed equivalent class: Subpattern and (isMadeUpOf some Subpattern)

allows to "slide" the matching of a pattern element to an another one. for instance, in the query "Ladies Night: ?producer", the keyword producer matches the property producer (from Musicbrainz) whereas the user is most probably interested in the object of the property, which is an instance of Artist (still in musicbrainz)
pattern element to wich a keyword from the pivot query can be matched
removed equivalent class: SubpatternCollection and (hasCardinalityMin exactly 1 integer[>= 1])
PatternElement which targets a class (can't be expressed in property restriction because owl:Class is part of the protected vocabulary)
removed equivalent class: SubpatternCollection and (hasCardinalityMin value 0)

rdf:Description.hasSentenceTemplateString: -1- -country-[" is located in " -3- ", " ] -highestPlace-[" has " -5- " for highest place" ]

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: the object of this property determines, depending on how many times it has been mapped in the considered query mapping, ...
... wether the concerned subpattern collection will appear in the generated query (if contingent) or how many times it will appear (if repetable)
à ignorer; ajouter à swip pour compenser le manque d'expressivité de Musicbrainz (tj le même exemple: une instance de mm:Artist peut être soit une personne, soit un groupe)
PatternElement which targets a property (can't be expressed in property restriction because owl:Property is part of the protected vocabulary)
PatternElement which targets a literal (can't be expressed in property restriction because rdfs:Literal is part of the protected vocabulary)
